humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: According to the pathology report, the patient has metastases in 1 axillary lymph node (No 1/X). Based on the AJCC staging system, this corresponds to N1. The report does not mention any other specific details about the number of lymph nodes or the presence of metastases in other locations, so we cannot apply any other N stage rules.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report mentions 'Metastases in lymphonodo (NO 1/X)'. This indicates that there is cancer in at least one axillary lymph node (N1). The 'No I/X' notation refers to the number of examined lymph nodes that contain cancer. In this case, '1' out of 'X' (an unknown number of examined lymph nodes) has cancer. Therefore, the N stage is N1.
